What are you thankful for this week?: U leboha eng ka beke ee?
What are you struggling with and how can: U loantšana le eng hona re ka thusa joang?
How did you put into practice the script: U kentse lengolo / pale eo re ithutileng eona ka nako ea ho qetela eo re kopaneng le eona?
Who did you share last week's lesson wit: U bile le mang thuto ea beke e fetileng ka hona 'me e ile ea ea joang?
What needs did you meet in the community: U kopane le litlhoko life sechabeng bekeng e fetileng?
Ask someone to read the passage one para: Kopa motho e mong hore a bale temana e le 'ngoe ka nako e le ngoe.
Have a group member tell it in their own: Na setho sa sehlopha se lokela ho e bala ka mantsoe a bona.
Ask the group if they added anything or: Botsa sehlopha haeba ba kentse eng kapa eng kapa ba siile letho.
When you finish with ALL paragraphs, ask: Ha u qeta ka lirapa tsohle, kopa motho e mong sehlopheng ho ea bolela pale eohle ka ho hopola. Etsa hore sehlopha se lokise liphoso.
What does this passage tell us about God: Seboka see se re bolella eng ka Molimo?
What does this passage tell us about peo: Seboka see se re bolella eng ka batho?
If this passage is true, what behaviour: Haeba temana ee ke 'nete, re lokela ho fetola boitšoaro bofe bekeng ee?
Who will you tell this story to this wee: U tla pheta pale ee bekeng ee?
What needs can we meet in the community: Re ka kopana eng sechabeng bekeng ee?
When do you want to meet again?: U batla ho kopana neng hape?
Would you like to discover with your fri: Na u ka thabela ho fumana metsoalle ea hau hore na Molimo o joang le hore na Molimo o batla hore u phele joang?
Here are some questions to get your disc: Mona ke lipotso tse ling ho etsa hore puisano ea hau e qale.
Would you like to discover for yourself: Na u ka thabela ho iponela hore na Molimo o joang le hore na Molimo o batla hore u phele joang?
Most people like to make these discoveri: Batho ba bangata ba rata ho etsa hore lintho tse ling li be le bana le metsoalle ea bona.
